alert.note: Alert for Logan; McDowell (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 7:34PM EST until February 18 at 4:16AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern West Virginia, including the following counties, Logan, McDowell, Mingo and Wyoming. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 734 PM EST, Automated stream gauges on Clear Fork and Dry Fork continue to indicate flooding impacts, though both sites have crested and water levels continue to fall. Some rural roads along other creeks within the warned area remain closed due to high water. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hanover, Gilbert Creek, Gilbert, Baileysville, and Clear Fork. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
